intro: Staurogyne novoguineensis, commonly known as the Guinean starwort, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists studying aquatic and semi-aquatic flora.
